business.headline: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase, CEO Jamie Dimon for $5bn over alleged debankingDonald Trump has filed a $5 billion lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase for closing his bank accounts. The case raises questions about political bias and banking practices in the US.

Gita Gopinath says 2026 will be a year of high uncertainty and volatilityIn an exclusive interaction with India Today at Davos, Harvard Professor and former IMF Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said that 2026 will be a year of high levels of uncertainty and high levels of volatility.

Richard Quest decodes Trump threats, tariffs and moreIn this exclusive India Today Davos Brainstorm session, Richard Quest, CNN Business Editor-at-Large, shares his insights on the shifting global order, Trump threats, tariff war and more.

PB Fintech Launches Pension Bazaar To Boost Retirement Planning In IndiaPB Fintech has launched Pension Bazaar, a new digital platform designed to facilitate end-to-end retirement planning for Indian investors.

How much should you really invest each month? Here's what expert saysThe same investment amount can mean very different things for different people, depending on income, responsibilities and life goals, says expert.

Zomato's Deepinder Goyal to return unvested ESOPs as he steps down as Eternal CEOAccording to Goyal, the move strengthens long-term employee retention without adding to shareholder dilution, something that is often a concern during leadership changes.
Sensex ends 398 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; BEL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 397.74 points to close at 82,307.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 132.40 points to end at 25,289.90.

India's banking system is resilient and prepared for global shocks: SBI ChairmanSetty said a key difference between India and many other economies today is the strength of its banking system. He recalled that after the global financial crisis and the subsequent spillovers, India undertook one of the largest clean-ups of bank balance sheets through asset quality reviews and recapitalisation.

India's growth story strong on AI and trade deals, says Tech Mahindra CEOAccording to Mohit Joshi, India's strength lies in execution, i.e., taking complex technologies and applying them at scale across large organisations.

Air India braces for roughly Rs 15,000 crore loss after deadly crash: ReportAir India is expected to post a loss of at least Rs 15,000 crore (about $1.6 billion) for the financial year ending March 31, said the people, who requested anonymity because the information is private.

8th Pay Commission: Pay revision, pension changes and fiscal impact explainedWith the 8th Pay Commission in focus, expectations are building around changes to pay and pensions for government employees. How might these revisions impact public spending, consumption and long-term fiscal health? Let's have a look.

Shadowfax Technologies IPO enters final day: Price band, GMP and should you apply?The allotment is expected to be finalised on 23 January 2026. Shares are likely to list on both the BSE and NSE on 28 January 2026, subject to market conditions.

Rupee slides to record levels. What the fall means for your daily expensesThe rupee's fall may look like a market story, but its ripple effects travel much further. What happens next could shape prices, travel costs and your monthly budget.

Budget 2026: Agri industry seeks stronger push for sustainability, nutrition and R&DAs India gears up for Union Budget 2026, voices from the agriculture sector are calling for policies that go beyond short-term gains and focus on sustainable farming, food security, better nutrition and stronger support for research and development.

Gold and silver keep soaring to record highs, but is it a boom or a bubble?In 2025, gold delivered its strongest annual gains in nearly 50 years, while silver posted its best returns ever. That strength carried into 2026, with silver crossing the Rs 3,00,000 per kg mark in India.

Tariffs or no tariffs, here's why global CEOs are betting big on IndiaIndia's rise in CEO rankings reflects a simple reality. Global companies want growth, scale and stability, and the numbers show India is delivering more of it than most major markets right now.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as global cues improve: Is the worst finally over?The rebound in Sensex and Nifty may not guarantee stability, but Thursday's sharp turnaround shows the benchmarks are finally finding their footing after weeks of relentless selling.

Sensex jumps over 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAs of 9:46 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 785.92 points at 82,695.55. The NSE Nifty50 climbed 251.60 points to 25,409.10. The strong opening showed that investors were willing to take fresh positions after recent uncertainty.
Sensex, Nifty rally over positive global cues, hopes of India-US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 760.64 points to 82,670.27, while the NSE Nifty added 246.10 points to 25,403.60 as of 9:40 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock market likely to open higher. Here's whyGIFT Nifty futures were trading at 25,338 at around 8:09 AM. This points to a positive opening for the Nifty 50, which closed at 25,157.50 on Wednesday.

entertainment.headline: Tu Ya Main trailer: Adarsh Gourav, Shanaya Kapoor try to escape a deadly crocodile The trailer of Tu Yaa Main shows Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor trapped in a pool with a bloodthirsty crocodile. The film is set for a theatrical release on February 13, 2026.

Karan Johar, Neeraj Ghaywan share emotional notes after Homebound's Oscar exit Karan Johar and Neeraj Ghaywan shared their first social media posts after Homebound missed getting a nomination at the 98th Academy Awards. Karan thanked Neeraj for collaborating with him for the film.

Oscars 2026: Homebound, India's official entry, snubbed; out of Foreign Film race Homebound, India's official entry in the Best International Feature film category, has failed to get a nomination at the 98th Academy Awards.

Sinners makes history with 16 nominations at Oscars, One Battle After Another gets 13 Sinners dominated the 2026 Oscar nominations with a historic sixteen nods, setting a new benchmark for excellence. It was followed by the One Battle After Another with thirteen nominations.

Emotional Rani Mukerji recalls Aamir Khan saying her voice was not apt for Ghulam Rani Mukerji celebrated her three-decade career by discussing the significance of her original voice in cinema. She recalled pivotal moments of her legacy with filmmakers Karan Johar and Aamir Khan.

When and where to watch shonen anime Jujutsu Kaisen Season 3 Episode 4 The fourth episode of Jujutsu Kaisen season 3 will be available for streaming on 22 January 2026, offering fans new content, a longer runtime, and dubbed versions across major platforms.

John Abraham didn't know acting but knew his limitations: Rimi Sen on Dhoom co-star Rimi Sen recalled working with John Abraham in Dhoom. She said that John Abraham initially didn't know acting, but hid it intelligently.

Palaash Muchhal accused of cheating Maharashtra man of Rs 40 lakh; complaint filed Palaash Muchhal is embroiled in fresh controversy following the cancellation of his wedding to Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana. A complaint has been filed against him in Sangli, accusing him of cheating a local man of Rs 40 lakh in a failed film investment deal.

Border 2, like Dhurandhar, banned in Gulf countries over India-Pakistan theme Border 2, set for release tomorrow, has been banned in Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE over its perceived 'anti-Pakistan' themes. The move followed recent trends with similar Indian films based on patriotic themes in the region.

Rajamouli calls Priyanka Chopra unstoppable after The Bluff trailer Filmmaker SS Rajamouli commended Priyanka Chopra for her role in the upcoming action film The Bluff, set to debut on Prime Video on February 25. He shared the note on X.

Varun Dhawan: Border 2 pushed me to my limits and changed me Varun Dhawan shared an emotional note ahead of the release of Border 2. The film also features Sunny Deol, Diljit Dosanjh, Ahan Shetty, Mona Singh, Medha Rana, Sonam Bajwa and Anya Singh in key roles.

2016 Bollywood dump: The Khans, Pink, and the year Hindi cinema grew up As social media revisits 2016, we look back at a defining year for Bollywood. The Khans dominated, sports dramas broke rules, Pink changed conversations, and Hindi cinema found its conscience.

Proud mother Kareena, doting father Saif root for son Jeh on annual day. Video Bollywood actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan attended the Junior School Annual Day at Dhirubhai Ambani International School, where they openly supported their son Jeh during his on-stage performance. A heartwarming video of the event went viral online.

Chatha Pacha review: Nostalgia-fuelled wrestling spectacle let down by weak dramaRelease Date:Thu Jan 22, 2026 Chatha Pacha movie review: The highly anticipated Malayalam film Chatha Pacha: The Ring of Rowdies directed by debutant Advaith Nair, stars Arjun Ashokan, Roshan Matthew, Vishak Nair and Ishan Shoukath in the lead.
Who are you? Bipasha Basu snaps at paps while shielding daughter Devi During a recent outing in Bandra, actor Bipasha Basu snapped at paparazzi who attempted to take pictures of her daughter Devi.

Mahesh Babu, children shower Namrata Shirodkar with love on her 54th birthday Actor Mahesh Babu, his children and Namrata Shirodkar's sister Shilpa Shirodkar sent birthday wishes to Namrata as she turned 54. Babu had the sweetest wish, calling her the strength of the family.

Chole bhature, volleyball, romance: Anushka-Virat's chemistry in new ad is pure joy Virat Kohli and actor Anushka Sharma feature in a new Dubai tourism ad, surprising each other with food and activities while showcasing their chemistry. The campaign highlights the couple's playful side as they explore Dubai together.

I wrote it in 2013: Raat Akeli Hai writer on Knives Out comparisons Writer Smita Singh discussed the origins of her script for Raat Akeli Hai, its perceived similarities to Knives Out, and her decision to step away from the murder mystery genre after the upcoming sequel.

James Cameron opens up on leaving the US and settling in New Zealand James Cameron says New Zealand's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and its unified approach to science motivated his family's permanent move in 2020, highlighting contrasts with the United States.

general news.headline: India avoids Davos optics as Pakistan joins Trump's Board of PeaceUS President Donald Trump launched the Board of Peace at Davos, with Pakistan joining but India staying away, raising questions on the initiative's global acceptance. The new body aims to promote peace and stability, focusing initially on Gaza's reconstruction.

Video shows Noida techie's final moments: Flashed torch as rescuers watched from afarFootage has revealed the final moments of a 27-year-old Noida software engineer, seen flashing his phone torch for nearly two hours after his car fell into a water-filled construction pit.

Won't play in India: Bangladesh boycott T20 World Cup, ICC to name replacementThe Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday remained firm in its stance, saying it won't play in India. The ICC, on Wednesday, rejected Bangladesh's request to change the venues, dismissing concerns of security threat for Bangladesh players in India.

Oscars 2026: Homebound, India's official entry, snubbed; out of Foreign Film raceHomebound, India's official entry in the Best International Feature film category, has failed to get a nomination at the 98th Academy Awards.

The million-dollar Vantara-inspired watch made for Anant AmbaniAnant Ambani is known to be a custodian of luxury, limited-edition watches. And now, one brand has decided to give his venture, Vantara, an ode in the most horological way ever.

India needn't lock itself into Trump's Board of Peace: Ian BremmerIndia is strategically positioned to engage with the United States under a potential second Trump presidency, maintaining strength without compromising global institutions. Political risk expert Ian Bremmer highlights India's unique partnership with Washington and its capacity to navigate complex international dynamics confidently.

Will US attack Iran? Big guns loaded, Israel prepares for surprise warThe US is moving defence hardware, including an aircraft carrier and fighter jets, closer to Iran, amid mixed signals from President Donald Trump. Israel has put it forces on high alert, expecting that any attack on Iran would make Tehran target the Jewish nation.

Knives out: US vs China playing out in Bangladesh ahead of pollsIt began when US envoy to Bangladesh Brent Christensen expressed concern over China's growing presence in South Asia and the risks Dhaka could face if it chose to align with Beijing. China was quick to rebut, telling the US, in effect, to mind its own business.

What Gautam Gambhir meant by his puzzling reply to Shashi TharoorGautam Gambhir's reply to Shashi Tharoor took an unexpected tangent. We decode what he said, why it struck a chord, and the pressures that shaped a cryptic response.
Don't know what G RAM G is, says Rahul Gandhi, BJP hits backLeader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi sparked controversy after admitting he did not know the name of the G-RAM-G Act during a speech.

Lula in India soon: PM after speaking to Brazilian President amid US tariff heatThe PM emphasised that close cooperation between India and Brazil remains crucial for advancing the shared interests of the Global South.

PM in Kerala, Tamil Nadu to lead BJP's mega campaign, project NDA unity tomorrowPrime Minister Narendra Modi will launch the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance's election campaign in Kerala and Tamil Nadu with back-to-back rallies, highlighting alliance unity ahead of the Assembly elections.
Caught on camera: Train rams truck at Jharkhand railway crossingA train collided with a truck at a railway crossing in Jharkhand, narrowly avoiding a major accident with no casualties reported.

Palaash Muchhal accused of cheating Maharashtra man of Rs 40 lakh; complaint filedPalaash Muchhal is embroiled in fresh controversy following the cancellation of his wedding to Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana. A complaint has been filed against him in Sangli, accusing him of cheating a local man of Rs 40 lakh in a failed film investment deal.

Ukraine-US-Russia trilateral in UAE on Friday: Zelenskyy after meeting TrumpEarlier, Zelenskyy said he had discussed security guarantees and a post-war recovery plan during his meeting with US President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Rain and snow to hit North India on Friday, weather shift expectedAn intense western disturbance will bring heavy rain, snow, and hailstorms to North India on January 23. This could lead to potential disruptions to the Republic Day rehearsals in Delhi.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan misses Republic Day week, makers now eye February releaseJana Nayagan's theatrical release is delayed due to a pending legal dispute with the CBFC. The film's makers now aim for a February release to avoid election-related screening restrictions.

Andhra's focus now on speed, not just ease of business: Chandrababu Naidu in DavosAndhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu highlighted the state's shift from easing business procedures to accelerating decision-making at the World Economic Forum, aiming to position Andhra Pradesh as a prime investment destination.

Blue Origin launches six paying customers on tourist flight to spaceBlue Origin's NS-38 mission successfully carried six passengers, including Laura Stiles, to the edge of space tonight. The flight demonstrated the power of reusable rocket technology with a precision vertical landing.

Will settle another war: Trump unveils Board of Peace for Gaza with 35 nationsUS President Donald Trump launched a new peace initiative at Davos, warning Hamas to disarm or face severe consequences. The Board of Peace aims to oversee ceasefire and reconstruction efforts in Gaza while fostering broader international cooperation.

When layoffs hit the 40s: Professionals tell their job-loss storiesCorporate professionals in their 40s are increasingly speaking out about how layoffs, age bias, AI-led restructuring, and aggressive cost-cutting are reshaping mid-career job security in India, turning what was once considered the most stable phase of a career into a period marked by uncertainty, stalled growth, and sudden exits despite decades of experience.

Return of dog-walker IAS officer to Delhi shows government respects latentIAS officer Sanjeev Khirwar, who was transferred to Ladakh after a dog-walking controversy, is back in the capital as MCD Commissioner. One of the key tasks that the dog-stroller babu will get is to deal with Delhi's street-dog problem. This could be a template for bureaucrats with special talents.

India office, Pak crypto deal: How Trump made Rs 12,800 crore in 2nd termDonald Trump, speaking in Davos, boasted that he was making America great and rich again. However, the US President seems to be pursuing a 'Make Trump Richer' agenda. According to an NYT report, the real estate mogul amassed around $1.4 billion since taking office a year ago.

Plate policing: Trinamool slams Centre over veg menu on Bengal-Assam Vande BharatIn response to fish and meat being removed from the menu, Indian Railways said, "We have decided not to include non-vegetarian items because the train connects two auspicious places - Maa Kamakhya Temple and Maa Kali Temple." An emotive issue for Bengalis, the move quickly became political fodder, with the Trinamool Congress seizing on it.

sports.headline: Gujarat Giants end losing streak as sloppy UP Warriorz implode WPL 2026, UPW vs GGW: Ash Gardner's Gujarat Giants went to second in the table after beating Meg Lanning's UP Warriorz by 45 runs on Thursday in Vadodara. Rajeshwari Gayakwad won the Player of the Match award for her three-wicket haul.
Casemiro to leave Manchester United at the end of the season Manchester United's Casemiro has confirmed his exit at the end of the season. His departure ends a successful four-year spell at the club.

Bangladesh vs ICC: Did Pakistan incite team's T20 World Cup boycott? Bangladesh remained firm in their stance of boycotting the T20 World Cup in India. It was a huge call considering the country might be thrown out of the tournament. Did Pakistan play a key part in triggering this problem?

Frosty handshake: Fiery Naomi Osaka, Sorana Cirstea share cold exchange in heated clash Naomi Osaka and Sorana Cirstea's second-round clash at the 2026 Australian Open sparked controversy after a brief, tense handshake and on-court tension. In the post-match press conference, Osaka also apologised for being disrespectful.

Vikram Sathaye On ICC Voting 14-2 Against Bangladesh's Demand To Play In Sri Lanka On this news bulletin, sports analyst Vikram Sathaye discusses the escalating tension between the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) and the International Cricket Council (ICC). Addressing the host Gaurav, Vikram confirms that the window for Bangladesh to play in Sri Lanka has effectively closed, stating, 'The ship has sailed, Gaurav. In fact, yesterday, when the ICC voted 14-2 in favour of retaining the original schedule, it meant that Bangladesh's demand wasn't met.' The discussion highlights the BCB Chairman Aminul Islam's reaction to a 24-hour ultimatum provided by the ICC and the internal conflict regarding government involvement in the decision-making process. Vikram points out the contradiction in Islam's statements, noting that while the Chairman initially requested time to consult the government, he later questioned the ICC's authority to issue an ultimatum. The segment also touches upon the safety concerns and national prestige associated with the team, particularly following Mustafizur's exclusion from the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Calls Grow In Pakistan To Boycott T20 World Cup In Solidarity With Bangladesh This news report highlights the growing social media commentary in Pakistan calling for the nation to boycott the T20 World Cup in solidarity with Bangladesh. Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has spearheaded these calls, accusing the International Cricket Council (ICC) of making a 'political move' that is 'too pro-India'. Latif stated, 'If Bangladesh doesn't play, then Pakistan won't play either,' while warning of potential threats to cricketers in India. He argued that the ICC has failed to protect Bangladeshi players and believes Pakistan must seize this opportunity to challenge the current global cricket order. Latif further claimed that without the high-stakes India-Pakistan clash, 'half the World Cup will anyways collapse.' Despite these calls, the report notes there are currently no formal grounds for Pakistan to withdraw, especially as their matches are scheduled in Sri Lanka under a hybrid model. The programme examines the potential impact of such a boycott on the tournament's stability.

Stubbs, Rickelton called up as injury concerns rattle South Africa South Africa face a challenging T20 World Cup 2026 build-up as injuries rule out key batters De Zorzi, Ferreira, and potentially Miller, prompting replacements Rickelton, Stubbs, and Hermann.

Bangladesh Boycotts T20 World Cup In India Over Security Concerns; Scotland To Replace Team On this Special Report, the focus is on the Bangladesh cricket team's decision to boycott the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The decision follows the International Cricket Council's (ICC) rejection of a plea to shift Bangladesh's matches to Sri Lanka, a proposal that was defeated 14-2 in a board vote. The speaker notes, 'The Bangladesh interim government had a chance to put cricket ahead of their shallow ego and politics but the latter eclipsed better sense and logic.' Bangladesh cited security concerns for its players and fans as the primary reason for the boycott, claiming a lack of fresh assurances from the BCCI or the Indian government. Consequently, Scotland, the highest-ranked non-qualified team, will replace Bangladesh in the tournament starting 7th February. The report highlights that this is the first time a team has boycotted an entire ICC tournament, leaving Bangladesh cricket in a precarious position following tensions linked to the release of Mustafizur Rehman from the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Novak Djokovic nears special 400, Jannik Sinner hammers James Duckworth Novak Djokovic advanced smoothly to the Australian Open third round, but it was Jannik Sinner who stole the spotlight with another dominant display. While veterans like Stan Wawrinka and Marin Cilic rolled back the years. Madison Keys, Iga Swiatek, and Naomi Osaka also progressed.

Pick me knock continues: Sarfaraz slams 17th First-Class century on Ranji return Mumbai gained control on Day 1 of their Ranji Trophy clash with Hyderabad as Sarfaraz Khan and Siddhesh Lad both struck centuries, recovering from early setbacks and guiding their team to a strong position by stumps.

What Gautam Gambhir meant by his puzzling reply to Shashi Tharoor Gautam Gambhir's reply to Shashi Tharoor took an unexpected tangent. We decode what he said, why it struck a chord, and the pressures that shaped a cryptic response.

RCB sale: Indian businessman Adar Poonawalla confirms strong bid for IPL teamIndian billionaire Adar Poonawalla has confirmed that he is launching a strong bid to acquire Indian Premier League franchise RCB. Ponawalla took to X to confirm his interest.

England's Ashes review claims first victim: Luke Wright steps down as selectorEngland's post-Ashes review has claimed its first victim as selector Luke Wright has decided to step down from his role. Wright will leave his post after the T20 World Cup 2026.

Shubman Gill makes horror Ranji Trophy return, out for 0 against SaurashtraShubman Gill's turbulent run continued as the Indian Test captain returned to Ranji Trophy cricket with a two-ball duck at No. 5 against Saurashtra on Thursday at the Niranjan Shah Stadium Ground C in Rajkot.

Nikhil Naaz On Bangladesh Out Of T20 World Cup: 'Politics Is Winning This Round'On this Special Report, sports editor Nikhil Naaz discusses the official confirmation that Bangladesh will miss the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The decision follows the ICC's rejection of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's plea for a hybrid model, leading to Scotland taking their place. Nikhil Naaz observed, 'Whatever was spoken there, I don't want to mention this. That is just between the players and us,' referring to the lack of transparency regarding the Bangladeshi government's talks with its players. The discussion highlights how political turmoil has turned a global tournament into a diplomatic flashpoint, marking the first time a team has been removed from a World Cup by the ICC. Naaz notes that while India maintains its stance as a safe host, the real losers are the cricketers whose dreams are sidelined by political standoff. The programme also touches upon the strained cricketing ties in the Asian circuit, involving Pakistan and the future of the Asia Cup.

In Quotes: Why Bangladesh decided to boycott T20 World CupBangladesh has decided to boycott the T20 World Cup in India due to unresolved security concerns. The BCB demands shifting the tournament matches to Sri Lanka to ensure player safety and fair participation.

Pakistan instigating Bangladesh with T20 WC snub and bring India down: Madan LalIndian legend Madan Lal has claimed that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to go ahead with the T20 World Cup boycott to bring India down. The Bangladesh Cricket Board announced on Thursday, January 22, that they have decided to snub the World Cup.

Madan Lal Slams Bangladesh's 'Foolish' Decision To Boycott World Cup In IndiaOn this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Madan Lal reacts to the Bangladesh Cricket Board's decision to boycott the upcoming World Cup in India. Madan Lal describes the move as 'foolish' and 'a stupid decision', suggesting that Bangladesh stands to lose significantly from a commercial and financial standpoint. He alleges that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to undermine India's position in global cricket. The discussion highlights the ICC's 14-2 vote in favour of the tournament proceeding in India, despite Bangladesh's security concerns. Madan Lal emphasizes that while the 'show will go on' with potential replacements like Scotland or Zimbabwe, the decision will severely impact the players who 'die for an opportunity to play in a World Cup'. He further warns that such political interference could have long-term repercussions for the Asian Cricket Council and the future of the game in the region.

Atul Vasan Slams Bangladesh's T20 World Cup Boycott: 'They Didn't See Through The Endgame'On this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Atul Vasan reacts to the Bangladesh government's decision to boycott the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. Vasan criticises the move as a 'rash decision', stating, 'I think it's quite funny because they actually didn't see through the endgame'. He argues that Bangladesh has 'cut their nose to spite the face' by mixing politics with cricket over safety concerns and IPL snubs. Vasan supports the BCCI and ICC for refusing to shift matches out of India, noting that the logistical challenges would be a 'nightmare'. He further suggests that Scotland could replace Bangladesh in the tournament, dismissing the impact of potential support for the boycott from Pakistan. The discussion highlights the shift in the global cricket order and the financial influence of India in the current revenue model, concluding that Bangladesh's absence will not significantly affect the tournament's competitive nature.

Won't play in India: Bangladesh boycott T20 World Cup, ICC to name replacementThe Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday remained firm in its stance, saying it won't play in India. The ICC, on Wednesday, rejected Bangladesh's request to change the venues, dismissing concerns of security threat for Bangladesh players in India.

Rohit Sharma conferred with honourary doctorate by Ajeenkya DY Patil UniversityFormer India captain Rohit Sharma received an honorary doctorate from Ajeenkya DY Patil University. The award recognises his leadership and significant contribution to Indian cricket.

Sunil Gavaskar jokes Abhishek Sharma hits fifty in balls he took to open his accountSunil Gavaskar joked about Abhishek Sharma after the Indian opener's scintillating knock against New Zealand during the first T20I. Abhishek scored a 35-ball 84 to get India the win in Nagpur.

Tendulkar salutes Saina Nehwal: You carried Indian badminton to the world stageSachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Saina Nehwal's illustrious career and contributions to badminton after the Indian ace announced her retirement from the sport recently. Nehwal is a former World No.1 in the sport.

Pakistan take dig at India, new series promo asks handshake bhool gaye?The Pakistan Cricket Board's new promo for the Australia tour has sparked controversy as many interpret it as taking a dig at India and their no handshake policy. Indian teams have refused to shake hands with their Pakistan counterparts in major tournaments following the Pahalgam attacks last year.

PV Sindhu becomes first Indian to complete 500 match wins, storms into quartersIndonesia Masters 2026: PV Sindhu became only the sixth women's singles player to complete 500 match wins in her career. The Indian shuttler defeated familiar foe Line Hojmark Kjaerfeldt of Denmark to storm into the quarterfinal of the Super 500 tournament at the iconic Istora in Jakarta.

Djokovic opens up on nostalgic Melbourne fig tree ritual after Australia Open winNovak Djokovic revealed his long-held fig tree ritual in Melbourne after beating Francesco Maestrelli at the Australian Open. The Serbian said the tradition grounds him mentally as he chases history in Melbourne Park this year.

Babar Azam's Big Bash League misery ends as Pakistan batter called homeBBL 16: Pakistan batter Babar Azam ended his stint in the Big Bash League before Sydney Sixers' crucial knocked out match against Hobart Hurricanes. Babar is expected to join the senior national team as it prepares for the T20 World Cup.

Babar Azam's stint at Big Bash League: Selling the dream, delivering the dotsThe hype arrived early, but the sixes did not. Babar Azam's Big Bash stint became a masterclass in how modern T20 cricket has moved on without him.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
